entity.description: Adam Raeburn-James is an experienced technology leader with a successful career spanning over three decades, primarily at Unilever and GSK. Currently serving as Chief Technology Officer and VMO at Unilever since December 2018, Adam oversees the strategy, design, and operations of global infrastructure and collaboration services. Previously, Adam held several senior leadership roles at GSK, including SVP of Global IT Operations, where Adam transformed global application and infrastructure operations, improving services for over 145,000 users across 120 countries with a significant budget. Adam also has extensive experience in creating unified IT divisions, delivering shared services, and managing large-scale projects, including delivering Glaxo Wellcome's first global messaging project. Adam holds a Bachelor's Degree in General Science from Newcastle University.

employments.description: Strategy, Design and Operations of Unilever's global infrastructure and collaboration services. Design and implementation of a new Vendor management function to manage 1.2B of shared services contracts. Achievements in the CTO role:- Migration of Unilever to 100% in the cloud. Decommissioning the datacentres. Establishment of cloud operations. At the same time reducing the cost of operations and no drop in availability- Migration of 4 of the largest SAP systems in the world to Azure - receiving "partner in purpose" award for the project partnership with Microsoft and Accenture. - Modernisation of all supporting infrastructure to support the cloud move, AD, Signal sign on etc. - Establishment and implementation of a zero trust strategy. Isolating critical applications and network segments.- 4 successive years of Gartner benchmarks establishing and maintaining a cost position at the bottom of the lower quartile. Achievements in the VMO role:- Designed and built a Vendor Management Function based on industry best practise. - Established standard process across the shared services for governance, risk management, obligation management, demand management etc- Established a partnership with Procurement saving 70M in the first year

employments.description: Lead the creation and execution of the GSK shared service excellence strategy across the GSK global shared services organisation. Services included: IT, Finance, procurement, facilities and HR. This programme set out the service model that GSK would use to deliver, measure and improve services. Achievements in this role included: • Building the ecosystem that all services run on today. Standardised, lean, measurement systems, incident resolution, problem management, service portfolio, service gateway, data and enabling systems. This drastically improved services and reduced costs by approximately 10% a year for 5 years successively. All major services attained greater than 97% customer satisfaction within 3 years. • Defined, built and grew GSK’s captive Business Service Centres in Poland (700 staff), Malaysia (400 staff) and Puerto Rico (400 staff). Materially improving service quality, consistency, reducing risk and providing salary arbitrage.

employments.description: Created a single global division providing infrastructure, collaboration and personal productivity. Combining End user services, European infrastructure services and core infrastructure.Budget of approximately £200M. Providing services to 500 sites and 140K users in 120 countries. Services included: security operations, networks, telephony, video conferencing, data centres, hosting, collaboration, desktops, mobiles, and service desksAchievements in the role included: • Driving a year on year efficiency process (leveraging lean sigma, procurement and sourcing) reducing headcount from 1400 to 750 in 5 years and reducing unit cost between 7% and 11% every year. Establishing GSK as “the” benchmark leader.• Transformed the infrastructure culture to proactive service orientation (previously focused on technical excellence). Improving service quality and responsiveness. Moving from the worst rated function in GBS to the best in the first 2 years. • Established and operated GSK’s first global security operations services. Services included: a true ‘follow the sun’ SOC, Perimeter Operations, Application Security testing, DR testing and security intelligence. This unit successfully protected GSK from major threats when other companies were compromised. • Created a mobile digital centre of excellence allowing the business to securely deploy and manage 40,000 iPads and 80,000 iPhones. Enabling the move to an iPad only solution for 40,000 sales reps. • Leveraged the Microsoft cloud to revolutionise the way GSK collaborates with virtual meetings, desktop video, social media becoming a way of life at GSK. Growing to 250K virtual meetings a month and 80% active users on social media.

entity.name: Maria Varsellona
allDescriptions: Maria Varsellona is currently serving as a Member of the Board of Directors at Sandoz and as the Chief Legal Officer and Company Secretary at Unilever. Maria has held various legal and executive positions in prestigious companies such as ABB, Nokia, and Tetra Pak. Maria has also been involved in board memberships at companies like Nordea and Alcatel-Lucent Shanghai Bell, showcasing their expertise in corporate governance and legal matters. Their vast experience and leadership roles make their a valuable asset in the corporate world.

Maria also held senior legal positions in GE Oil & Gas, with a specific focus on managing legal affairs for commercial operations and global services. As an admitted lawyer in both the UK and Italy, she started her career working for law firms in these countries. Maria has lectured on international contract drafting and negotiations at the University of Florence, Italy and also served the European Commission as a member of an elite stakeholder panel appointed to harmonize contract laws in Europe. Maria holds a degree in Law from the University of Palermo in Italy. In her free time Maria likes to be in her house in Sicily with her family.

entity.name: Hein Schumacher
allDescriptions: Hein Schumacher is the Chief Executive Officer of Unilever. He previously worked as the Zone President of Asia Pacific at Kraft Heinz. Hein Schumacher attended the University of Amsterdam.

Hein Schumacher was appointed as a Non-Executive Director of Unilever PLC in June 2022 and his appointment took effect in October 2022. He is a member of the Audit Committee. Hein Schumacher has been the CEO of Royal FrieslandCampina, the Dutch dairy co-operative, since January 2018 after serving three years as the company’s CFO. He also currently serves as the Chair of the Global Dairy Platform. Prior to joining Royal FrieslandCampina, Hein spent 11 years in various strategy and financial management roles at Kraft Heinz across Europe and Asia, including Chief Strategy Officer, Vice President of Finance for Europe, and Executive Vice President and Zone President for Asia Pacific. He also served as the Corporate Controller, Asia and Central America for Ahold NV. Hein began his career as a finance manager at Unilever.

allDescriptions: Fernando Fernandez is the Chief Financial Officer of Unilever. He attended the University of Buenos Aires.

Promoting positive change is what has driven me during my 30+ years at Unilever. In April 2022 I became President of Unilever's Beauty & Wellbeing Business Group. Beauty & Wellbeing, which is comprised of four businesses – Skin Care, Hair Care, and the newer business units of Prestige Beauty and Health & Wellbeing – includes some of the most exciting brands in the industry including Dove, Clear, Vaseline, Liquid IV, Paula’s Choice, Hourglass and others.My team and I are putting Purpose, Science and Desire, at the centre of our strategy to drive growth and help create a new era of beauty and wellbeing which is joyful, inclusive, equitable, and sustainable.

entity.description: A seasoned global business and strategy leader, advisor and coach, with capital markets, investment banking and private equity career foundations. Deep experience and long tenure with both incumbent industry leaders and dynamic disruptors, including early-stage growth players in beverages and wellness.Extensive experience driving business growth and transformation agendas at corporate and divisional levels. Recognized as a CPG leader in the US, Europe and emerging markets, driving rigorous, insight-driven strategic decision-making, alignment, org transformation, rapid scaling and institutional investor support. Led strategy, portfolio, route-to-market and M&A engagements for a range of McKinsey’s large, mid-size and PE clients.For over a decade, co-architected and built SABMiller/MillerCoors, a $100 billion global beverage group consisting of both leading brands and a portfolio of small, dynamic US craft brands. Built influence and trust across management, distributors, directors and shareholders through economic cycles, executive and board change, JVs and major M&A across continents. Currently Chief Strategy Officer at Unilever. Board director or observer for over 20 years at private equity investee companies, corporate subsidiaries, and the UK Investor Relations Society. Entrepreneurial executive coach/mentor within Unilever and in connection with the UCLA Anderson School of Management.

employments.description:
Responsible for all manufacturing Units in South Africa inclusive of 3rd Party Operations, Supply Planning and Inbound logistics.The role supports performance improvement across multiple sites and categories in South Africa and has a direct impact on manufacturing performance KPI’s improvement. The role is also focused on internal and external functional benchmarking and also builds Manufacturing Excellence Capabilities. 

Key areas of focus are on Talent pipeline & Development, Manufacturing Excellence, Cost Management, Customer Service, Capital Expenditure & Strategic Investments, Quality and SHE deliverables for the country with link into the Africa region as a whole.
employments.title: Vice President Manufacturing

employments.description:
Manufacturing Executive responsible for all aspects of the Foods business in South Africa.

To lead and manage the entire site as per the production targets set by the business and as per the agreed operational agenda in terms of Unilever factories in South Africa. This involves managing a team of 10 Managers and total factory compliment of 500 employees.

The site produces a 100 different sku’s and has a total annual volume of 132,000 tons which is managed on a 4 shift continuous operation system.

The key responsibilities in my current role are:
-	Being a member of the Margarine Business Team managing a category of R 2bn
-	This includes being profit responsible and delivering the 3% GM contribution that the sourcing unit is responsible for
-	Be the Sole custodian of the IR relationship on site
-	Achieving production targets through the Sales & Operational Planning (S&OP) Process
-	Managing manufacturing costs (Rand / ton)
-	Managing overall site performance in terms of quality, safety, health and environmental issues (SHEQ). 
-	Implementing Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP’s) as per global standards.
-	Manage Stock Record Accuracy and driving the Working Capital Program
-	Managing plant maintenance to improve and optimise overall equipment efficiency and availability
-	Manage Cap-ex Projects and 5 year investment plans
-	Providing leadership, coaching and counselling to the team
-	Managing the production and inbound planning process for the site
-	Leader of the Regional Virtual Site (RVS) for Spreads in Asia, Africa, Middle East & Turkey. This involves managing 13 sites across the geography and is an organization comprised of supply leaders from factories with similar technologies / business model that support achievement of targets
employments.title: Manufacturing Director

employments.description:

The site produced a 150 different sku’s and has a total annual volume of 10,500 tons which is managed on a 2 shift system with the occasional use of 3 shifts during high demand.

entity.description: Tish Archie-Oliver is twenty years into a successful career as a Diversity & Inclusion Practitioner and Talent Management expert. After spending the majority of her career in the financial services industry, she decided to transition to the Consumer Packaged Goods industry to diversify her experience and for the opportunity to build a best-in-class campus recruitment function. After five successful years, she transitioned to Tiffany & Co. to serve as the Director of Recruiting Initiatives and Diversity Outreach. In this hybrid role, she was responsible for partnering with senior leaders across the enterprise to identify, hire and retain talent at all levels, developing the recruitment strategy for the Tiffany Academy for Excellence and Diversity in Retail Leadership program (an 18-month leadership program) and developing the diversity and inclusion employee engagement strategy. Currently, Tish serves as the Head of Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging at Unilever. Tish dedicates her life to serving the community and developing the next generation of leaders. She serves as a member of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated, Scholarship Cha of the National Coalition of 100 Black Women Bergen-Passaic Chapter and an Advisory Board member for Brooklyn College’s School of Business.

After five successful years, she transitioned to Tiffany & Co. to serve as the Director of Recruiting Initiatives and Diversity Outreach. In this hybrid role, she was responsible for partnering with senior leaders across the enterprise to identify, hire and retain talent at all levels, developing the recruitment strategy for the Tiffany Academy for Excellence and Diversity in Retail Leadership program (an 18-month leadership program) and developing the diversity and inclusion employee engagement strategy. Currently, Tish serves as the Head of Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Belonging at Unilever. Tish dedicates her life to serving the community and developing the next generation of leaders. She serves as a member of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Incorporated, Scholarship Cha of the National Coalition of 100 Black Women Bergen-Passaic Chapter and an Advisory Board member for Brooklyn College’s School of Business.
